property.configure: Michal Owsiak - michalo [at] man.poznan.pl (PSNC-EU Euforia project)

configure.p: Displays the values of the tokens arriving on the input channels in a text area on the screen. This actor is based on a concept of Display actor but it treats inputs different way. Each time input is connected, actors send it to the tab specified through displayName parameter.
Multiple Tab Display actors have following advantages:

ul.li: it allows sending message to the same tab from different Multiple Tab Display instances
it allows sending message to multiple tabs from the single Multiple Tab Display instance
it allows sending messages from different levels of workflow (in terms of composite actors) into single tab display
it allows to trigger other actors with boolean value (it produces boolean value at output port)

configure.p: You can find demo workflow related to this actor at following address:
Each tab generated by Multiple Tab Display have unique name that allows sending multiple messages to the same tab during workflow execution

property.name: port:trigger
property.configure: A multiport that has no declared type (in other words, the port can accept any data type: double, int, array, etc.) If the port is connected, the actor will not fire until the trigger port receives an input token. Connecting the port is optional, but useful when scheduling the actor to perform at a certain time.

property.name: port:input
property.configure: A input port for text to be shown within Tab.

property.name: port:output
property.configure: Boolean Token with true value for each connected sink.

property.name: prop:displayName
property.configure: Tab to be used when displaying the text.

property.name: prop:addNewLine
property.configure: Determines whether newLine character should be added with each new line.
